intro: Tingulonga subserrata, commonly known as the serrated tingulonga, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have serrated margins, contributing to its common name. Tingulonga subserrata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
